result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven J. KHAIL was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving Stolen Property >$5000 - $10,000 or Firearm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(bm).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Manitowoc County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: concurrent with 15 CF 596 but consecutive to 12 CF 35.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay $758.00 restitution to Allen Close, 1021 17th Street, Two Rivers, WI 54241 and $60.00 to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department, 1025 S. 9th Street, Manitowoc, WI  54220.
Maintain full-time employment/job search schooling combination.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Use only one doctor for prescriptions and only one pharmacy.

Have no association with any known drug users or dealers.

Have no contact with Allen Close.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
